title: Add System.register output format to published npm package
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
Feature

**What is the current behavior?**
The react and react-dom packages are currently published to npm in cjs and umd formats. See the cjs and umd directories at https://unpkg.com/react@16.8.6/

**What is the expected behavior?**
Myself and the systemjs community would love to see a [System.register](https://github.com/systemjs/systemjs/blob/master/docs/system-register.md) bundle published to npm and cdns. This would be as simple as [creating a new bundle](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/0b50fb29f7147fd821e9a0c126eb297e27b639a5/scripts/rollup/build.js#L618) that changes the [rollup output format](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/master/scripts/rollup/build.js#L183) to `system`. The bundle could go into a directory called `system`, similar to the `umd` and `cjs` directories, and would be published to npm. See [this pseudo code demo](https://rollupjs.org/repl?version=1.10.0&) for how rollup very easily compiles bundles to System.register format.

The downside to doing this would be that `npm install react react-dom` would include a system bundle that most people would not use -- extra bytes to npm install it. Those bytes would not be included in browser bundles, but only in the node_modules.

The advantage would be that those who do use systemjs@>=2 would be able to `System.import('https://unpkg.com/react/system/react.production.min.js')` **without any configuration** and everything would work. Currently, users of systemjs@>=2 must include the [amd and named-exports extras](https://github.com/systemjs/systemjs#extras) in order to be able to System.import react bundles on unpkg, cdnjs, jsdelivr, etc. Those extras are a couple extra network requests that could be avoided, and some configuration that is a barrier for usage.

SystemJS, although old for an open source project, has seen a recent burst in development with version 2.0 and 3.0 coming out in the last several months. The new 3.0 version is a polyfill for [import maps](https://github.com/WICG/import-maps), which is a compelling browser spec. There are over 100,000 weekly downloads for SystemJS.

I am happy to PR this myself, if the react team is amenable to the change.
